title: ﻿pink light
text:
stoners
beneath the 
pink light
racing to get
the last
can of 
monster 
on a
sunday night
while the
staff
stack shelves
and
talk about 
dating
drowned out 
by the 
sterile 
light 
when I drive home
I see figures 
dressed
in white
shifting
in the 
darkness

title: campus
text:
an ocean of clouds
and the
orgasmic sun 
bursting through 
to wash
the sky
with pinks
and blues
without my 
headphones
I hear
the lost
dreams
of ex-students
in the
motorway’s
thrum
the empty
campus
retreating
to darkness
leaves
the cows calm
beneath the
milky clouds
I hear
the birds
tweet
the sun
talking to the
tallest
branches
that stretch
towards
heaven

title: evening poem
text:
at dusk 
all the 
bees are 
in their beds
little white flowers 
spread over 
the grass 
look like 
flecks of 
cocaine
soon to be 
hoovered up 
by my 
lawnmower
I am the stillness of the trees
and the whir 
of the motorway
I am the little bats
that dance
around my
head
their little wings 
nodding
at the 
dead

title: two lonely children
text:
you're all talk and
I'm all talk too
we dance
and dance
until our heads are 
spinning
just for a chance
to say that we're 
winning
don't look 
inside
to what we cover up
two lonely children
in our 
hearts 
are stuck

title: father’s day poem
text:
to dad
I write 
the cursive 
in the 
card
free and 
easy
happy 
father's day
I don't 
elaborate
I know 
you are 
understated
and you'll feel it
either way
I sign 
my 
brother's name
like he 
did it 
himself
it is all done
with love

title: pub poem
text:
the bell chimes
across the tiled floor
a grandfather 
clock ticks 
in the back
the waitress 
teases me
with looks
that I 
half imagine
how I would like to 
unlock 
her
to lay her in
my victorian 
bed
her feet
as cold as a 
cadaver
many 
strange visions
come and go
memories
I sip my coffee
trying to look confident
yearning
for something

title: on the avanti west coast train to glasgow
text:
it's rainy outside
but sunny in my head

I see myself 
on the camera 
and 
question
where does all the cctv go?

more creating
more letting go
less criticising
less chastising

as the glorious 
greens of the countryside
pour into
my 
dream cup

three cheers for
a lack of control
and
what comes
what comes
what comes!

title: say yes
text:
standing on bus stop trolleys
cycling on curbs with a flat tire 
having someone say yes
makes me dumb
dancing through the streets 
like a new film 
new promises
and the old 
fear 
to let someone 
know
and to have them 
reciprocate
to even 
suggest
is exquisite 
to exist
and to let all the songs 
sing in my
heart

title: electric shoulder touch
text:
electric shoulder touch
promise
all the while
I long to 
touch 
you back
however
incidental
a gentle movement
a brush past

instead
we laugh and talk
and the
electricity
of that touch
fades

halted by the fleeting moment
we embrace
and let the
scarlet wishbone
break

title: elwood streets
text:
the orange 
and 
brown leaves
have fallen
in elwood streets
the avenues of
trees
and the warm winds
when I see you
it's with 
an open mind
a space to be
what is your mystery?
the secret story
of your
internal
life

title: my bloody valentine
text:
I'll never
be able
to listen to 
my bloody valentine
the same 
again

life changed 

singing to the empty streets 
I'll be your plastic toy 
I'll be your plastic toy
I'll be your plastic toy!

title: last of my weed
text:
I threw the last
of my
weed
away
laid it out
in my palm
flat
and offered it
to the fat horizon
to the grey sea
to the little fishies
and to bob marley

cannabis
you have grown tiresome
stuck playing the same note

I throw it far into the waves
and it plops
and it's gone
suddenly like
northern lights
an apparition
shines
up towards me

my body shakes
I rub my schnozzle
fasten my coat
and begin the
long journey
home
against
the
wicked wind

title: give all of me
text:
in life you have to give yourself
arms open
with a second coffee
but
the neon 
empty promises
linger
the sex dreams 
on
sticky floors
I want to
peer behind the
beer mat
surrender to nights alone
surrounded by throes
of people
stuck in white 
heat
all so I can give more
of myself
to the people
I care 
about
for everything
in the
world
I want to
give
all of
me

title: it might be the 8 pints
text:
I am a sensitive boy
but I 
don't like pandering
and fawning
I sit and watch
my manager 
display
it in 
droves
the secret alliances
and barriers
marked out
to keep mouths
complicit and silent
to outsiders
the sound of nasal laughter
from inside the walls
make me
feel sick

it might
just be
the 8
pints

title: to my panicked part
text:
to my panicked part
I know you feel so alone
but you aren't alone anymore
I'm sorry I wasn't there
for so long
now in 2024
I come as your friend
the insurmountable tasks
I can do them
I want to be here
until things are free and easy
I want to go through it all 
with you
listen to old jazz records with you
and dream of the 
amalfi coast with you…

title: afca poem
text:
I walk
with my white 
coffee cup
happily passing
all my city chums

my manager
the red haired 
sycophant
sucking up to the
cool crew

I breath
I block
I blame

- please take a seat
the manager
says into
the microphone
- take responsibility
I think
as I park my bum
at the
operational excellence
annual
get together

title: untitled
text:
so many
girls
to fall
in 
love with 
I didn't write 
enough
love 
poems 
I was 
in love 
with 
my own 
headaches

title: call to arms
text:
depressed?
anxious?
ptsd?
call me!
time to reign it in fellas
stop beating your wives!
stop beating yourselves over the head with a rusty kalashnikov
hug your wife!
hug your children!
thank the postman
try a therapist on medicare and expand your life!
expand your wife's love for the world!
don't leave her
make love to her!

make love to her like it's the last time!
one day it really will be the last time
so pretend it's today!
and don't be scared to be the first one
that's kind and tender
and loving
we need more of that in the world!
together we don't have to get swept up
in our antisocial compulsions!
otherwise it's nil by mouth!
and your children and your children's children
and your nan and your uncle tom and even your own dear mother
everyone dead and alive you hold dear
will be travelling on a merry go round of shit and despair
for a very long time
thank you

title: freakup
text:
you are
sunshine
on red brick
terraces

you were mine
a slow
resonant 
note

but
but
and
above all 

you are 
a cold bright 
morning 
that lives in my
heart
forever

title: your look back
text:
even broke up
we secretly meet sometimes
I don't care what anyone says
I want to see you
we drink mulled wine
and have a wandering
sort of day
in the crisp winter cold
you are the human being
I am 
most comfortable with

the wine goes to our heads
I rest my hand on your thigh
the night feels strange and sad and empty
apart from the touch of your hand
and your cheek
we say goodbye at the pub
and you walk away
but you looked back
you looked back
and I hope to have your smile
that is so
uniquely and 
beautifully yours
with me
forever

title: fucking cunt
text:
fucking cunt
fucking cunt
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt

title: brad
text:
we all have a brad in our lives
brad who won't cast his long lanky arms
around me
brad with his knuckles taut and strong
wrapped around my neck
dirty little brad
a silence
then
- did anyone go to the secret rave?
someone says
- it wasn't so secret if everyone was posting about it on instagram
brad scoffs
then he whispers to his friend
right in front of us
tell us the gossip brad!
I demand to hear it brad
and I realise how different I am to all these little oinks
they walk away without any glances my way
the sky rains deeply
no one loves me
not even brad

title: at least I have you
text:
all these people
are going to die
in the sunshine
I can't plan anything
listening to the durutti column
on my cycle to work
giving each face it's fair share
of attention
at least I have you to hold me
and calm me down
at least I have you

title: does jonathan richman shave his pubes?
text:
does jonathan richman
shave his pubes?
he looks like a hairy lad 
what a beautiful boy
but if he dislikes the internet
and screw top wine
there is no chance 
that down there
is trimmed and fine
I love you jonathan

title: the trees
text:
the trees 
encode 
hidden messages
and I want 
to explore 
myself
for the rest of my life
regardless of my job
or my status
I want to commune 
with that thing 
that lies
in the
stillness
of nature 
and 
sparkles

title: cous cous
text:
you always
wanted
me to
love
myself
now
I'm crying
eating cous cous
the simplicity
of it
it's our dish
how can this
set me off
and the songs
and random images
of us
living peacefully
in chorlton
you reach into
the fridge
we watch tv
on the sofa
part of me
screams
no I don't
want this

title: âme at sub club
text:
at âme
on a 
bench 
I submit
to the 
bass
with 
the help 
of 
gear

title: goat haiku
text:
co-op shop has goat
in aisle 3 head in the fridge
eating all the cheese

title: cow haiku
text:
rusty railway line
can't take the cows to stockport
a faulty brake light

title: haiku
text:
berlin wall stand tall 
shattered faith biscuit tin fall
around it's waist scum

title: apple haiku
text:
apple seeds grow tall
become trees fall in my lap
eat green granny smith

title: jonny haiku
text:
little jonny walk
he feels the ground go yellow
jonny fall down hole

title: rathdowne street
text:
every day after work
I walk along
rathdowne 
street 
in the sun
and stop off at the great
northern hotel
for a lime and 
soda
the bubbles rising
in the glass
I take a slow sip
the ice cubes
shining
like jewels

title: every morning
text: every morning the high flying workforce arrive to melbourne city. you can tell us from our recyclable coffee cups. we wear them like badges of honour, copious amounts of us who actually think our coffee is better than anywhere else in the world. and we actually think our coffee cups get recycled. every morning, white cups will pile up in special recycling points, one hole for the plastic lid, one for the paper cup. and we think we've done our bit. out of sight, out of mind. we're high flying city workers, perhaps we're entitled to it.

title: untitled
text:
rolling 
up 
my pension
plan
to
snort
this 
coke

title: girlfriend size?
text:
you can
tell
a lot
about a 
man 
by the
size
of 
his 
girlfriend

title: espressos
text:
I drank three espressos 
and I'm still exhausted 
moving across the fault lines
guilty by design 
mostly serpentine and unfeeling 
come here and hug me

title: untitled
text:
in tokyo 
I just
saw
a man
wipe 
his 
dogs 
bottom

title: on the train in tokyo
text:
I am becoming intimately aware
with the zippers and crotches
of the men standing 
in front of me
on the train
the girl reading her book 
with a grimace
the fold of the business men's trousers
the pretty women
the western families
the ones in kangol caps
I love them all 
and I see beneath
because my heart is broken
the hearts beneath 
all the fancy clothing
aren't they the same?
why have I not 
seen this before?
something so simple 
and pure

title: leaving melbourne
text:
airport taxi 
sunset
bleeding
eyes burning
disgusting and 
mild mannered
wayward seat sitter
bus squatter
I fly away
squarely sat on a chair
trying to avoid
the sinking
coffees to say goodbye
then take off
bye bye bye
the sky bus
blue vials
that makes you throw
your arms about
like a baby

title: dolphins
text:
dolphins
of the big blue
are mammals
like me and you
bottlenosed
in the indo pacific
I say hello
with a wave 
and a click

smiling with my teeth
your true feelings
are blocked to me
but we 
mix and
float
in the cold bath
the mighty sea

title: hug
text:
when I hug you
it feels so painful
I hold onto fragments
when we were
first
together
my mind 
won't even let me go 
back there 
now
it'll take me years
but I know right now
I need you 
to feel safe
in my arms
while you sleep

title: big fleshy balloon
text:
it's hard 
to let go
of 
smoking
weed 
when your 
girlfriend's 
bum feels
like 
a 
big fleshy balloon 
and 
you're 
bouncing
your face
on it

title: untitled
text:
when we argue
and get down to it
and nearly break up 
I come to my senses 
and return home 

it's the first time
I feel anonymous 
walking down chapel street

the world doesn't realise 
how broken
it is
there's too much brunch

title: walk poem
text:
mantis ray
tattooed guy 
card handed in by well wishing stranger 
I am the roadside walker
past enchanted farm land
grey skies 
and green grass like cordial
I drink it all in
really having no idea where I'm going
and wanting to be elevated 
another stretch 
a new field 
and an alpaca 
backed up by his little mates 
behind him

title: food and beverage attendant
text:
28 year old food and beverage attendant 
slowly unravel from years and years 
of a stressful job
and learn to serve plates 
but still I wonder around collecting glasses
with a crazed expression 
scaring the customers
I'm a slow learner

title: we make the sunset
text:
the sun sets on the church steeple
and the orange pokes through the trees
the birds look like bats
and locusts call out
flies bite my legs
and dog owners lurk in the dark
then the water fountains turn on
paid by the church
your favourite colour is blue
mine is orange
together
we make the sunset

title: tram girl
text:
that girl with the flowy curly hair
feeling herself
walking 
looking from side to side
that feeling
of feeling yourself 
being in your body 
and feeling good
makes me feel warm now
and I wizz past her on the tram

title: youth
text:
youth
can squeeze
the life
out of
sunshine
and put it in a glass
from the green of the trees 
to the sky
and infinity 
music carried you through flight 

youth
I can't get it anymore
but I am more grounded 
now
is it a worthy exchange?
now the world feels more real
right?
now the world feels more real

title: love poem
text:
it feels so strange
that you love me

like I don't deserve it
like I don't deserve anyone

while you sleep
I finally become clear
watching your breath
so deep and easy
always letting go
your love for me
is always letting go

title: drinking
text:
I'm drinking 
it makes 
my
mind blank
staring into space
hearing naked 
sound
from the convos 
of people
passing round
my posturing
recedes
and what is left?
I see myself
in every face
it will be me
someday
there is a hole
in the sky
that burns 
white 
with
embers

title: homeless singer
text:
I am the slow lover of bruises 
of soft cuts and scars
from the one on my nose
the feelings pour out like blood 
I am the slow lover of simple things 
simple songs sung by you
the busker
I can feel the earth in your voice
and want to cry 
listening to you
in your pink shirt
and tattered trousers 
I can see it in your eyes 
beautiful homeless singer

title: weed man
text:
weed man
gonna pick up 
for some excitement
lonely soul
on saturday 
pure pleasure 
call my momma 
call my mate jake
pommy fuck
shouldn't be ashamed
gonna get money in soon
and I've joined my union 
of artists
and 808 bass 
sydney bass

title: breakup poem
text:
why
is it 
only now
that the 
feelings 
come 
gushing 
I can 
listen to 
songs
I've avoided for
months 
I see love
in all the
pedestrian 
faces 
why do we 
regress 
at the 
end of a 
relationship 
to the feelings
from the 
start?
I drive around
crying
listening to
the songs 
you put in 
my playlist
and I see you
clearly
for the 
first time
in months 
years 
why?
and 
what 
now?

title: britishnes
text:
how long before the confidence I've gained
is wittled away
by the british mentality 
and the passive aggression?
I feel my jaw clench when I walk past my locals
feel myself crawl into myself
happy to not share what im passionate about
to keep to myself and hide it all behind
a forced half smile 
and a I'm fine thanks 
how are you?

title: untitled
text:
the bridge is a jungle 
with the faces that I see 

beautiful pink palace
in the forest 

an emotion 
from me to you

title: falafel
text:
my girl makes 
thick falafel
her long legs
dancing
to the country 
song
on the radio 
- you look like a lumberjack
she said
in my flannel 
and boots

title: keep making
text:
keep making 
it's all worth while
it's all good 
better than you think 
before anyone believes in you
just express yourself
that's enough

title: night bus
text:
crossing state lines
move through cold sunshine
lips cracked and 
shoes dusty 

a stomach bug 
from dirty meat
I'm running out of time 
on the hell bus 
flying through the night 
flying through the night
